Author: DDHoward

Comment: "It authorizes the president to ask the Secretary of Commerce to determine if goods are being imported in manner that threatens national security."  "The act allows the president to impose tariffs if the U.S. International Trade Commission (ITC) finds that an import surge is threatening a U.S. domestic industry."  "allows the United States Trade Representative (USTR) to authorize tariffs on foreign countries that restrict U.S. commerce in “unjustifiable,” “unreasonable,” or “discriminatory” ways. If the USTR confirms such behavior after an investigation, the president has the discretion to allow the USTR to impose tariffs for at least four years."  Exactly.  And, in pretty well all these cases, there was no threat to national security, no legitimate threat to US domestic industry, and no unjustifiable, unreasonable, or discriminatory tariffs placed on the US by other countries.  According to all the relevant laws cited, Trump should not have the power to do what he has done.
Author: MJcorrieviewer
